alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 8:07AM MDT until May 17 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Near Chamita affecting Rio Arriba County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by other multiple causes continues. * WHERE...Rio Chama near Chamita. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, overbank flooding into properties near the river will occur above 6.5 feet, especially in areas near the confluence of the Rio Ojo Caliente and the Rio Chama north of the Highway 285 bridge over the Rio Chama. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 6.7 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1000 PM MDT.
